content.title: Grant Scheme for Marriage of Daughters of Destitute Widow
content.details: “Grant Scheme for Marriage of Daughters of Destitute Widow” scheme is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for the marriage of the daughters of the destitute widows who are being given widow pension by the Social Welfare Department.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
The applicant should be a girl/woman.
The applicant should be a widow.
The applicant should be sanctioned for widow pension from the district probation office.
The monthly income of the applicant’s family should not exceed ₹4,000/-.
Or, the applicant should belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Level) category.
The bride (daughter of the applicant) should be between 18-45 years of age and the groom should be between 21-45 years of age.
documents_required: Antyodaya Card/ BPL Certificate/ Income Certificate.
Copy of marriage certificate issued by the Registration Office.
Certificate of date of birth of the bridegroom/bride (High School Certificate/Birth Certificate/Family Register/Aadhaar Card/Family Register).
Copy of Savings Bank account (should be seeded with Aadhaar).

faqs.question: What is the objective of “Grant Scheme for Marriage of Daughters of Destitute Widow”?
faqs.answer: “Grant Scheme for Marriage of Daughters of Destitute Widow” is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to the destitute widows for the marriage of their daughters.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Daughters of the destitute widows are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of financial assistance can be availed through this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to the beneficiaries to cover their expenses of marriage.

faqs.question: What should be the age criteria for the bride and groom?
faqs.answer: The bride (daughter of the applicant) should be between 18-45 years of age and the groom should be between 21-45 years of age.

faqs.question: What should be the income criteria for the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The income of the applicant’s family should not exceed ₹4000/- per month.

faqs.question: How can the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications can be made online at: https://ssp.uk.gov.in/Home.aspx.

faqs.question: Whether the application can be tracked?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications can be tracked from: https://ssp.uk.gov.in/frmApplicantionVerificationDetailAtDiffLevels.aspx by providing Application Number/Mobile number/Aadhaar number.
